thread.title: The Conversation Hour: Raising awareness and raising funds
thread.title_full: The Conversation Hour: Raising awareness and raising funds

title: The Conversation Hour: Raising awareness and raising funds
text:
The Conversation Hour: Raising awareness and raising funds Share Download (21.19 MB) MP3 available 21.19 MB 
Jon Faine's co-host is broadcaster, cruciverbalist, and author David Astle . He's going to be a part of The Wheeler Centre Gala 2017: Stories for the Dead at Hamer Hall, Arts Centre Melbourne, this Sunday (26th Feb, 2017) at 5:30pm. 
Their first guests are Stuart Radley (Leading Firefighter, Dandenong Fire Station) and Adam Young (Leading Firefighter, Mildura Fire Station). Following the death of their colleague Nathan Shanahan who struggled with Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD), and in recognition of the high rates of depression and PTSD amongst firefighters and other emergency services personnel, Stuart and Adam are encouraging others to join them in the Walk Off the War Within Challenge at Victoria Park, Ballarat on Saturday 22nd April, 2017 from 9:00am. The 20 kilometre walk (with a 20 kilogram pack) aims to raise awareness of PTSD and depression. 
More information here: walkoffww.com 
Then they are joined by Associate Professor Andrew Kornberg and Andre Jones . 
Andre is a 55 year old running solo from Melbourne to Darwin to raise money for for Beyond Blue. You can learn more and donate by visiting: https://give.everydayhero.com/au/melbourne-to-darwin-running-for-beyondblue-3700kms 
Andrew is a Senior Neurologist and Director of RCH Global at the Royal Children's Hospital Melbourne. He's flying solo around Australia to raise funds for the RCHH Complex Movement Disorders Program. You can learn more and donate at the Fly For The Kids website here: flyforthekids.org.au 
If you feel the need to talk with someone after hearing this conversation, you can contact your doctor, or immediately get in touch with: 
Lifeline - www.lifeline.org.au - phone 13 11 14 
BeyondBlue - www.beyondblue.org.au - 1300 22 46 36 Duration: 1hr Broadcast: Mon 20 Feb 2017, 11:00am Published: Tue 14 Feb 2017, 2:56am Credits
